page.title: 18FARMING IN GRIMSBY-OLD CLEE
page.content: {An Urban Farm In A Conservation Area. Originally a dairy farm{17C Clee Hall and 5 acres of land were bought by Mr. M.H.Wyatt in 1957.The remaining land became a playing field. Mr Wyatt also owns{Old Clee Riding School}but this was not part of the original farm.The main{commercial}use is{poultry.}1600 to 2000{chickens}arrive when they are one day old and remain for 7 weeks, kept in two{wooden buildings.}They eat 86 tons of dried pellets.They are killed and{frozen for meat at a food {firm.}Local residents sometimes { complain}about the{smell}although there was no smell when we visited the farm.Mr Wyatt keeps vintage cars in the old farm buildings.The remaining land is used for{grazing horses.Plans to make{the farm into a club}and {build houses}and{a filling station}on} the land have been{refused by council.
